title: boxr: A high-level R interface for the box.com API
text: Directories identified using dir_id: note words “directory” “folder” used interchangeably, can confusing. Box uses term “folder”, R world seems favor term “directory”. assume familiarity R Box; thus also favor term “directory” name functions arguments. also recognize fully consistent implementation. functions take (return) dir_id: box_setwd(), box_getwd(): set get default working directory Box. box_dir_create(): create Box directory. box_ls(): list files Box directory. Cloud storage services can complement version control systems code, aren’t well suited large binary files (e.g. databases, .RData, heaps pdfs). Box explicitly versions binary files, keeping old ones, making easy fall back older copy. boxr provides git style facilities upload, download, synchronize contents entire local remote directories. Box API support directly, boxr loops recursively directory structures. box_push(): update Box directory new/changed local files. box_fetch(): update local directory new/changed Box files. functions, sure pay attention arguments: overwrite, default FALSE. delete, default FALSE. recursive, default TRUE. Disclaimer: Box replacement VCS/remote-database, familiar verbs guarantee expected behavior! check function documentation jumping .

title: boxr: A high-level R interface for the box.com API
text: boxr’s functions designed ‘pipeable’. ’s little example:
code: library(boxr) library(dplyr)  # 'nycflights13.json' is the same as nycflights13::flights, if you want to # follow along at home  box_auth()  box_search("nycflights13.json") %>%                # Find a remote file   box_read() %>%                                   # Download it as a data.frame     group_by(origin, dest, month) %>%              #   Do some, er, cutting edge     summarise(mu = mean(arr_delay), n = n()) %>%   #   analysis with dplyr!   box_write("delay_summary.xlsx") %>%              # Convert to .xlsx, upload   box_add_description("Check out these averages!") # Add a description to your file!

title: Design Philosophy
text: (Ian) firm believer following Postel’s Law helps us (users) avoid hard--diagnose trouble. may know, Postel’s law says “flexible accept; strict return”. words, strive accept interpret users’ input long intent clear, specify clearly function returns adhere strictly specification. famous Tidyverse example subsetting data.frame , default, return vector rather data.frame one column specified: avoid behavior can specify drop = FALSE, sometimes forgotten – even experienced R users: tibble designs problem away. Following Postel’s law, subsetting tibble always returns tibble; want vector, call another function. strict output. figure functions return, want keep Postel’s Law mind.

title: Design Philosophy
text: boxr package exercise abstracting away Box API; sometimes abstraction helps developers like forget actually . ’s . API classified according endpoints resources; think analogous R functions objects. Box API comprehensive; possibly aspire cover . Instead, goal provide easy access many day--day endpoints can, provide way help access others need . functions call one endpoint, e.g. box_ls() calls list items folder endpoint. Others functions call multiple endpoints, e.g box_fetch() calls list-items endpoint, well download file endpoint. function calls single endpoint (perhaps even repeatedly), return response (collection responses) API returns. Consider content sample response list-items endpoint: sample response shown Box web-page different response actually get. example JSON, "entries" element, quote numeric values, e.g. {"id": 0}, whereas actual response quote numeric values, e.g. {"id": "0"}. may seem inconvenient, may help us although elements like file id nominally integers, often larger R’s integer-maximum. reason, think boxr’s perspective, id remain character string. said, think can parse things: , smaller, numbers integers, case "etag", "sequence_id". datetimes, elements seem end "_at". logicals; elements seem start "is_", "can_", "has_". ’s parsed content. content list, entries element lasting information; elements deal pagination. ’s things get interesting. stands, many boxr’s functions, e.g box_ls() return entries list lists, attaching S3 class boxr_object_list. minimally processed, allowing please. S3 class .data.frame() method convert element data frame. (want data frame 99% time, inconvenient call .data.frame() 99% time.) behaves much like internal function , stack_rows_df(): prefer tibbles, another function, stack_rows_tbl(): couple things might notice: stack_rows_df() returns data.frame. List items unnested; nested item names delimited ., e.g. file_version.id. stack_rows_tbl() returns tibble. List items remain nested.

Default read-function rio::import() format = "csv", uses data.table::fread(). box_read_tsv() parse remote TSV file data.frame. Default read-function rio::import() format = "tsv", uses data.table::fread(). box_read_json() parse remote JSON file R object. Default read-function jsonlite::fromJSON(). box_read_excel() parse remote Microsoft Excel file data.frame. Default read-function rio::import() format = "excel", uses readxl::read_excel(). box_read_rds() parse RDS file R object. Uses readRDS().

title: Search Box files — box_search
text: Object S3 class boxr_object_list.

title: Search Box files — box_search
text: Box API supports maximum 200 results per request. max > 200, multiple requests sent retrieve combine 'paginated' results , behind scenes. See box.com search description details features service. notable details: Full-text searching default available many source code file types, R scripts. default Box seaches word/token uses operation e.g. box_search("") equivilant box_search("") Reserved words boolean operations , , (uppercase ) interpreted special context e.g. box_search(""), box_search("") Exact phrases can matched surrounding double quotation marks e.g. box_search('"exact phrase"') box_search("\"exact phrase\"") Searchability instantaneous can take >10 minutes newly uploaded file become findable

title: boxr S3 Classes — boxr_S3_classes
text: boxr_file_reference describes file created, modified, deleted Box. returned box_ul(), box_save(), box_delete_file(), etc. available methods: print(). boxr_folder_reference describes folder created deleted Box. returned box_dir_create(), box_delete_folder(). available methods: print(). boxr_dir_wide_operation_result describes result directory-wide operation. returned box_fetch() box_push(). available methods: print(), summary(). boxr_object_list describes collection files Box. returned box_ls(), box_search(), related functions. available methods: print(), .data.frame(). boxr_dir_comparison describes difference directories. returned internal function box_dir_diff(). available methods: print(), summary(). boxr_collab describes collaboration (sharing permission). returned box_collab_create(). available methods: print(), .data.frame(), tibble::as_tibble(). boxr_collab_list describes collection collaborations. returned box_collab_get(). available methods: print(), .data.frame(), tibble::as_tibble(). boxr_comment describes comment file. returned box_comment_create(). available methods: print(), .data.frame(), tibble::as_tibble(). boxr_comment_list describes collection comments file. returned box_comment_get(). available methods: print(), .data.frame(), tibble::as_tibble(). boxr_version_list describes collection version information file. returned box_version_api(). available methods: print(), .data.frame(), tibble::as_tibble().

title: boxr 0.3.6 (development)
text: update internal helper Box ids. (#90) update minimum version rio package reflect newer treatment JSON files. (#261) remove unused internal function, removing dependency httpuv package. (#259) update superseded function-calls gargle, used testing. (#251) default branch switched master main. (#252) refactor use withr functions handle temp files. (#183) activate tests box_save(), box_load() (#255) update documentation reflect updates rio package. (#242, @chainsawriot) update maintainer’s email address. (#248) update use inherits() (vs. string-comparison) determine class-membership. (#246) harmonizes default location tokens. Now, ~ resolves home directory platforms. patch applied offering move tokens “old” locations. (#219 w/@danielruss) adds updates GitHub Actions testing coverage. (#206, #247, #256) update documentation: README, external-package links, pkgdown, add alt text figures. (#275, #276, #279)

title: boxr 0.3.6
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-19

title: boxr 0.3.6
text: adds vignette("design") sketch different design philosohies appear boxr functions. (#170) deprecates x argument box_write() favor object. (#187) return objects can printed tibble (vs. data-frame). enable behavior, set options(boxr.print_tibble = TRUE) (perhaps .Rprofile). new tools manage collaborations: box_dir_invite() deprecated favor box_collab_create(). adds box_collab_create(), supports file group based collaborations. also adds box_collab_get() check existing collaborations, box_collab_delete() delete. box_collab_create() box_collab_get() return (list-based) response Box API. prefer work data frames, return-objects .data.frame() as_tibble() methods. box_previous_versions() superseded favor box_version_history(): returns data frame includes columns version_no (numeric) version_id, rather version (character) file_version_id. exports internal function box_version_api(), interested unparsed content response API. new function box_version_number() returns current version file; number consistent version_no argument used functions box_dl(). new functions box_read_rds() box_save_rds() work RDS files directly Box. new function box_browse() open browser window directly given folder file Box’s web app. new functions box_comment_create() box_comment_get() create get comments Box files. functions return specially classed lists API response, can use .data.frame() as_tibble(). uses httr::RETRY() API requests handle momentary issues network connectivity. Thanks @jameslamb @chircollab! box_ls() provides current version_id default. (#185, @alexbrodersen)

title: boxr 0.3.6
text: box_file_delete() box_folder_delete() now return invisible(NULL). (#197) box_auth_service() resilient bad-request failures. (#166) box_auth() longer throws error {usethis} installed. (#168, @malcombarret) ... now passed write_fun box_write(). (#144) box_ls() robust remote folders contain links. (#140) box_previous_versions() fixed “-previous-versions” case. (#139)

title: boxr 0.3.5
text: adds automatic-retry authentication functions, box_auth() box_auth_service(). (#131) adds box_auth_service() support OAuth2.0 using JWT, also adds box_dir_invite() invite collaboration Box folder. makes easier authenticate box.com remote computers (e.g. RStudio Cloud, RStudio Server) (#23) modifies box_source(): adds ... argument pass arguments source(). modifies box_write(), box_dl(): deprecates filename argument favor file_name. modifies box_auth() (#96): deprecates write.Renv argument copies text clipboard, rather overwrite .Renviron file returns invisible(NULL) upon success deprecates box_auth_on_attach() (#96) adds logo (#92, @nathancday) converts pagination method offset marker-based paging (#79, @awong234) adds option return specified fields box_ls() (#72, @awong234) adds updated screen shots (pngs images/) description creating Box App new Box Developer Console UI. Also added reference box_auth_on_attach step 4 ‘’re done’. (#57, @nathancday)

Various parameters can set search filenames, file contents, limit searches certain file types. Results summarised default, can coerced via .data.frame. can also passed place file_id boxr functions (e.g. box_dl) perform operation first result. box_read_excel Finally support everyone else’s favorite way store data! box_write convenience function convert R objects common file types (e.g. .json, .csv, .tsv, .xlsx, etc.), upload box. Using default write function (rio::export), file type can determined automatically filename provided. box_add_description simple way add description file box.com. useful way describe contents file, can also used like commit messages GitHub, describe recent changes made. box_fresh_auth convenience function users trouble authenticating – delete existing tokens (default hidden files) fresh authentication process S3 classes files, folders, object lists Objects class boxr_object_list can passed directly functions place file_id string Objects class boxr_object_list now .data.frame method
